alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:39PM EST until February 18 at 3:16PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. For the Tuscarawas River...including Massillon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuscarawas River At Massillon. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Agathon Park area to Route 21. Water encroaches on Route 62 in Navarre. Flood waters may force the closing of two railroad crossings in Massillon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 18.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 845 AM EST.
